topics.body:
Fun Activity with Friends: 

When we go sing at karaoke, we play this game called Sing This Way. Basically one enters a song he/she knows then the others dare them to sing it in a different manner. Like to sing My Way in a laughing tone or in a sad tone. Sometimes we get odd dares like singing a song in a Russian accent, etc.

topics.body:
"@hype":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/559811e26368725658000ed6#post_559811e26368725658000ed6
i dont listen to the same stuff that i used to From that era, back then there were some really talented early Post-Hardcore bands from that time back before the genre got taken over by scene chicks and emo kids, bands like Thrice, At the Drive-In, Thursday, Glassjaw, Alexisonfire and Finch were incredible. same thing with Metalcore in that era, it was originally filled with talents like Converge, Norma Jean, Underoath, Poison the Well, Haste the Day, ZAO and Spitfire, but now its just generic scenekid bullshit 

i also like some of the more obscure and semi-obscure Punk bands from that era like Saves the Day, Crime In Stereo, Bayside, AFI Alkaline Trio, Against Me and Hot Water Music


and by Post-Punk i mostly mean Joy Division and The Cure, those two bands have been my life since Junior High
